content:
I'm glad to hear that you were invested in the story and characters! The Last of Us Part II is indeed a masterclass in storytelling and character development. Ellie and Abby's complex and nuanced characters are a big part of what makes the game so compelling.

The themes of revenge, trauma, and the cycle of violence are indeed powerful and thought-provoking. The game does an excellent job of exploring the consequences of violence and the emotional toll it takes on the characters.

And ah, I'm sure that feeling of finally defeating a tough boss is incredibly satisfying! It's a testament to the game's design and difficulty curve that it can evoke such a strong sense of accomplishment.

As a side note, it's interesting that you mention Abby as one of your favorite characters. She's a complex and polarizing character, and opinions about her are often divided. What did you think of her character arc and her motivations?

(By the way, I'll avoid any spoilers in case anyone reading this hasn't finished the game.)
